articles.title: Malaysia and Indonesia block X over failure to curb deepfake smut
articles.summary:
PLUS: Cambodia arrests alleged scam camp boss; Baidu spins out chip biz; Panasonic’s noodle shop plan; And more!

Asia in Brief  The governments of Malaysia and Indonesia have suspended access to social network X, on grounds that it allows users to produce sexual imagery without users’ consent.…
articles.reasoning: The article describes government actions to block a social media platform due to non-compliance with national laws regarding digital content, specifically non-consensual deepfakes. This directly involves the governance of IT systems and digital platforms to ensure they adhere to regulatory and legal standards, a core aspect of IT Governance.

articles.title: Meta admits to Instagram password reset mess, denies data leak
articles.summary:
PLUS: Veeam patches critical vuln; Crims bribing dark web insiders; UK school takedown; And more

infosec in brief  Meta has fixed a flaw in its Instagram service that allowed third parties to generate password reset emails, but denied the problem led to theft of users’ personal information.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses Meta's response to a security flaw in Instagram, involving incident handling, system fixes, and communication about data security, which relates to IT governance frameworks for managing IT risks and controls.

articles.title: AI industry insiders launch site to poison the data that feeds them
articles.summary:
Poison Fountain project seeks allies to fight the power

Alarmed by what companies are building with artificial intelligence models, a handful of industry insiders are calling for those opposed to the current state of affairs to undertake a mass data poisoning effort to undermine the technology.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses deliberate data poisoning to undermine AI models, which relates to IT governance by addressing ethical use, security, and control over technology and data practices.

articles.title: Brussels plots open source push to pry Europe off Big Tech
articles.summary:
Call for Evidence casts FOSS as a way to break US dependence

The European Commission has launched a fresh consultation into open source, setting out its ambitions for Europe's developer communities to go beyond propping up US tech giants' platforms.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses the European Commission's strategic initiative to reduce dependence on foreign tech giants through open source, aligning with long-term organizational strategy and competitive positioning.
